author: BernardoDeGalvez
body:
Skyworks (SWKS) Is fairly valued

Micron too (MU)

author: bloppingzef
body: Trade desk, Sun Power, SkyWorks, Fastly and AMD. I could give reasons as to why each are innovative, but as of this time they’re a major innovative disruption in their sectors.

author: hiifiit
body: Is it just me or is Swks in an almost identical boat…. Numbers, graphs, locations, and all

author: BernardoDeGalvez
body:
They just beat earnings. There is room for the industry to grow more than the damage for losing one client (not for SWKS if they lose Apple, since they are 50% of their earnings).

But both companies are growing, making smart moves like acquiring other companies, buying back shares....

author: BernardoDeGalvez
body:
Insurance I like Aflac, Unum and Cigna. But I only own Cigna

Long term and under the radar, I like Skyworks (SWKS)

And I'm looking closely into LYB and VRTX
 Bbbbbrt.gtgg. 
My country (50M population) just approved  VRTX products to treat CF in exclusivity. The news went under the radar, but since the Soxial Security pays for the treatment and everyone is gonna be treated "free" (even inmigrants)... I think VRTX IS GONNA have a big boost on earning because of this

author: iWriteYourMusic
body: Yet again everyone sleeping on my babies SWKS and INDI

author: bloppingzef
body: Somehow Tesla will benefit, but a realistic answer from me is Skyworks since the bill also has the development of 5g for military bases in it.

author: Unoriginal_White_Guy
body: TM/HMC/GM/STLA for auto, MS/PYPL for financials, INTC/WDC/SWKS/UMC/KLIC for tech/semis, SPG for REITs, and ANTM for healthcare/insurance. I believe cyber security will be a big winner in the years to come, but I can’t justify buying at these prices. I follow CRWD, OKTA, ZS, and NET. Like I said though everyone has my same idea and these companies are highly over valued IMO. For nearly all of 2021 I’ve been deep into oil and steel stocks since I thought they were super under valued. I am completely out of steel now because this clown market only cares about tech at the moment. I have way more companies I follow, but most are small caps around 1-3B that I view as undervalued that show growth potential and that doesn’t fit your criteria.

author: 95Daphne
body:
While it has just been NVDA/AMD at times, since the Nasdaq bottomed on October 4th, there have been plenty of semiconductor stocks that have done really well:

AVGO: +18.6%

AMAT: +20.8%

(two holdings of mine)

LRCX: +23.7%

(was a holding of mine but I let myself get spooked about the way semis were running, I shouldn't have sold it)

MU: +22%

QCOM: +45%

While some of them have been bleh, most SOXX stocks look more like AVGO and AMAT than SWKS and QRVO, and it's a bit of an under the radar reason why the Nasdaq got back to a record and looked fine underneath until a couple weeks ago.

author: hiifiit
body:
Very true, hopefully Skyworks gets some new projects because their fundamentals are really solid imo

Edit: I also expected them to dip because a similar thing happened last earnings when they beat expectations by a cent then went down 6% the next day

author: stackcheesesitds
body: Little self promotion but $indi..... Automotive semiconductor fables design, chip shortage, acquisition of lidar company terexion, 2bil backlog and growing TAM, former CEO of skyworks., ETC ETC.... Earnings this week

author: solovino__
body:
Guy below me explained it well. I wasn't saying all companies will go bankrupt. Some are very healthy companies and chips will be needed now more than ever. Very low chance of them going bankrupt unless a catalyst comes forward in the near future (I'm not a psychic). But like I said, just cause a company is in an industry with a positive outlook does not mean today, Nov 19, 2021, is the perfect time to hop in.

(I'm not a financial advisor)

My picks on Semiconductors is Skyworks $SWKS for potential growth, Qualcomm $QCOM for stability. Skyworks is a smaller market cap company who supplies chips to industries in IoT, infrastructure, medical, defense, and more recently, automotive. Would I hop in right now? Nope, but I'm eyeing it.

PS ratio 5, PE ratio 17, PB ratio 5, no LT debt in the past 7 years until last quarter actually. Industry has positive outlook (chips). Great margins, Gross 50%, netting 30%. Since 2014, lowest ROE has been 19%. In other words, for every investor dollar they have, they are making 20 cents. Very effective return industry, and market wide (be careful when other companies have high ROE. Taking on debt will increase ROE but as I mentioned, Skyworks has had no long term debt in the past 7 years until last quarter. Some companies take on debt which makes their ROE attractive). Debt-to-Equity ratio has been 0 since 2014 (no debt) until last quarter which puts them at ratio 0.42. Still a very low ratio. Trading volume is relatively low and high enough for liquidity purposes. 

By far the greatest company I have found in the semiconductor industry. The only thing that pushes me away is the high PS ratio. Would consider only purchasing below $110. But guess what, if it doesn't reach it, that's fine too. I missed it, big deal. There's always, or will be, another one.

Qualcomm is a stable company with similar ratios. But at a $200B market cap, not much room for a high multiplier like $SWKS.

author: seditioushamster
body: Indi semiconductor. Management team from skyworks and apple well positioned to take the lead in auto semis in lidar, lighting, autonomous, power management and entertainment. Apple carplay to name another.. Already with over 20 oem relationships with major manufacturers. Despite 2 acquisitions this year they are debt free.

author: Immediate-Assist-598
body: SWKS is a beaten down (for no reason) top tech name.

author: Immediate-Assist-598
body: How about making your own ETF for Undervalued Dividend King Blue Chip Telecommunications stocks?  As often happens, the worst performers of the recent past become the best performers in the near future. So my recommendations for this fictional ETF are T, VZ, VIAC and SWKS.  All way down from their highs and unfairly so and all big dividend payers. T especially, though their div gets reduced to "only" 5% after they spin off Warners-HBO and then you get Discovery-Warners stock plus the original T stock.  The market seems to be pricing in a complete failure by HBO Max-Discovery-Warners as well as Paramount Plus. I disagree on both counts. You can burn through Netflix and Disney in a few months and have nothing left you are eager to watch, so people need multiple streaming subs to stay entertained. I also don't buy that movie theaters are ever going to be what they once were, only for big wide-screen type epics would I ever bother going to a theater again and I used to go to the movies 100 times per year.

author: R4N7
body: Mmm yeah, you can add them too except they are much smaller and don’t really compete with big guys like AMD and NVDA. Intel spend on R&D ~14B in 2021, SWKS entire market cap is ~26B

author: Immediate-Assist-598
body: I know one thing, I own four of the most undervalued Class A quality dividend paying stocks in the market.  The most undervalued is VIAC which reportedly has been hijacked by hedge fund short sellers manipulating it downward despite plenty of good news for the actual company in the real world. Two others are the big telcos T and VZ, both very cheap with large dividends. JUst a buyer's strike for the last 3 months or so.  Then there is SWKS, a big Apple supplier and also diversified chip company.  Maybe the cheapest high-end chip company. All four of these have been bad losers recently, but IMHO all are now coiled springs.  I al down 100 K on paper with these but if I had cash I would buy them all now without fear.  Meanwhile 90% of my money has always been in AAPL and today is a great day for AAPL holders, and because AAPL's PE is still 30% lower than inferior company MSFT's, I recommend that as well.
